com.yantra.api.wms.putaway

Interface getPutawayLocations

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface getPutawayLocations

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getPutawayLocations(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      getPutawayLocations suggests locations for put away in a given Node for both LPNs and Items (non-license plated products).

    • Method Detail

      • getPutawayLocations

        org.w3c.dom.Document getPutawayLocations(YFSEnvironment env,
                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                         java.rmi.RemoteException

        getPutawayLocations suggests locations for put away in a given Node for both LPNs and Items (non-license plated products). Put away may be done for some department (this is defined as FromActivityGroup) such as VAS, REPLENISHMENT etc. For a given purpose, Enterprise and Node, the locations suggested for the inventory (SKU/LicensePlate) at the source location follows algorithm given below:

        1. InventoryType determination: If the inventory is loose SKU, then InventoryType is SingleSKU. For a LicensePlate, depending on the inventory it contains, it can be either SingleSKU, MultiSKU or UnknownSKU. For multi-level License Plates with inventory, InventoryType is always MULTI-SKU.
        2. Activity demand check for Inventory: If ForActivityCode is passed, activity demand against this ForActivityCode is checked. Otherwise activity demand for all ForActivityCodes against the FromActivityGroup, which is passed in the input, is considered. If work order details are passed, activity demand against this work order is checked. If wave details are passed, activity demand against this wave is checked. If multiple activity demands exist, they will be processed according to priority. In case multiple demand exists for the same priority, demands against shipments will be satisfied first, then demands against order, then demands with only sku information will be satisfied. If activity demand exists for the inventory, then it is fulfilled for the mentioned quantity(or less than that) in the order of priority assigned to activity code and for the remaining quantity(if any) normal put away is done.
        3. UOM determination: Based on the quantity of the inventory (for a SingleSKU Pallet/Case and MultiSKU Pallet (with put away as SingleSKU), quantity is the PalletQuantity) and SKU details, UOMs for which put away is to be considered are determined.
        4. Best match condition for zone selection: Zones are selected using a best match criteria based on InventoryType, UOM, ItemClassifications, EnterpriseCode, ProductClass, LPNType, NodeKey, InventoryStatus, SegmentType, Segment and ForActivityCode (this is assumed to be 'STORAGE', if there exists no activity demand for the considered inventory and ForActivityCode is not passed). The order of priority is: EnterpriseCode descending, UOM descending, LPNType descending, ProductClass descending, InventoryStatus descending, SegmentType descending, Segment descending, ItemClassification1 descending, ItemClassification2 descending, ItemClassification3 descending.
          In case of a multiSKU Pallet, the best match condition found is used for determining the flag 'Putaway each SKU separately'. If its value is 'Y' then for each SKU of pallet, put away is done in singleSKU mode. Best match putaway condition found for the Pallet is not used any more and put away conditions are determined separately for each SKU in the Pallet. When the flag if not set, and no location can hold the pallet, putaway alogorithm will not downgrade the Pallet to its Child Cases and suggest location for Cases.
        5. Zone List determination: For the best condition determined, priority ZoneList is determined from put away preference table. This ZoneList contains Zones with priority and StorageCode. This ZoneList is sorted in increasing order of priority number (priority number having value 1 is the highest priority).
        6. ZoneList Filteration: The determined prioritized ZoneList is further filtered by applying constraints: Same building number as source location, Enterprise and Capacity (i.e. number of locations for the SKU, it is applied only for SingleSKU mode).
        7. Location List determination: Locations of type REGULAR,DOCK and STAGING and that can at least hold one package (satisfying both Volume and Weight) are selected from the above ZoneList. If location is of type STAGING, it should be associated with a station. Infinite Locations would not get suggested when empty if the zones to which they belong have mixing constraints defined. They are prioritized as:

            8. Priority1: Locations having same receipt and same SKU as the inventory SKU.
            Priority2: Dedicated locations for the SKU.
            Priority3: Locations having the same SKU as the inventory SKU.
            Priority4: All empty locations.
            Priority5: Remaining locations.

            If "Minimize No of Locations per SKU" flag of the zone is checked and mixing of receipts is allowed for the Zone, locations with same SKU will be given higher priority than empty Dedicated Locations.

        8. For multiSKU LPNs and unknownSKU LPNs, no priority is set on same SKU and dedicated locations. Same receipt locations get the highest priority.

        9. These locations are sorted by priority, (location Velocity - SKU Velocity) ascending, location velocity descending, available capacity ascending, distanceFromDedicatedLocations ascending, and putaway sequence ascending.
        10. Best fit location suggestion: In best fit, following constraints are satisfied:
          • Locations Capacity. Here Volume, Weight and location dimensions are taken care of.
          • Number of locations for the SKU in a Zone. For singleSKU mode only.
          • Maximum quantity of a SKU that can be put on a location (it is done only for dedicated locations). For single SKU mode only.
          • For a package type, maximum number of packages (it is defined based on itemClassificationCode and Enterprise) that can be put.
          • All mix constraints defined at Zone level are satisfied for the target location.

        11. Best fit algorithm is applied to find the best locations. Goal is to find:
          • Smallest location that can hold entire inventory, satisfying the above constraints.
          • If such location cannot be found, try to fit as many integral number of packages without violating the above constraints.
        12. If some packages are left behind, downgrading of the package type is done. And put away location suggestion starts all over again.
        13. If no downgrading is possible, location for remaining quantity of the inventory remains unsuggested.
        14. For the loose inventory received, quantity for which location is suggested is in multiples of UOM's.
        15. Handling location suggestion for non-catalog items. There exists two scenarios in this case.
          • Item exists in Catalog, but no UOM record exists.

            • In this case UOM is considered as same as inventory UOM passed. The dimensions of this UOM are set as same as UnitUOMDimension from the ItemRecord and weight is assumed as the UnitWeightUOM. If unitDimensionUOM's and UnitWeightUOM are not specified in ItemRecord, both are set as same as that of ShipNodeLocale.
          • Item does not exist in Catalog.

            • In this case all dimensions are set to Zero and VelocityCode is set to 'Z'. UnitDimensionUOM's and UnitWeightUOM are set as same as that of ShipNodeLocale.
        16. Activity demand for multi SKU case is supported only when demand is specified for the container number.
        17. Put away location suggestion API may be invoked for product even though product is currently not in inventory. Following are the scenarios for which this may be required:
          • Simulate put away of inbound trailer to validate if there is enough space in warehouse before pulling trailer to dock and start receiving.
          • Dynamic slotting.
          • Sorting while receiving : Put away location is determined even before product is actually received into inventory.

          Following assumptions are made for the scenario when ConsiderCurrentInventory is not true/Y:
          1. Put away of Multi SKU pallet is not supported.
          2. For a License Plate put away, a dummy license plate is assumed to be in the inventory with container number as passed in the input XML. Dimensions and weight of the LPN are defaulted to zero. If no inventory attributes (Item not passed) are passed then this is assumed to be Unknown SKU license plate, otherwise it is assumed to be Single SKU license plate.
          3. InventoryTagKey and ReceiptHeaderKey are set to blank values.
          4. For loose SKU put away, dummy SKU is assumed with ItemId, ProductClass and UnitOfMeasure as passed in the input XML. Quantity of the sku that needs put away must be passed.
          5. If source location is passed then locations are suggested in the same building as that of source location. Otherwise, locations can be suggested any where in the Node.
        18. For an outbound container, getPutawayLocations API finds a location for the next activity that needs to be performed on the container. Activity Constraints may be configured to dictate the location that would be picked up for that activity. When all activities to be performed on a container are completed, the container would be directed to the Shipment's sort location. Pallets may be built for the shipment at the sort location if so mandated by the container pipeline. Additionally for shipments that are marked PackandHold, when getPutawayLocations API, is called on any of the shipment containers, the API would suggest locations for storage (based on activity constraints defined for STORAGE).



        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exit:


          WMSGetLocationPrioritySchemeUE
          WMSGetPreferenceZoneListUE
          WMSCanLocationBeSuggestedForPutawayUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions:

      • An XML that contains the details of the inventory along with the destination locations is generated.
      • If the put away was for activity demand, demand location is suggested along with activity demand details (activity demand key).
      • If no location could be suggested for the inventory, the inventory remains unsuggested.

        • Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains the details of the quantity for which location could be found, the quantity for which location could not be suggested and the quantity for which acivity demand fulfilled. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
